title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Industrial Production Managers

content.rendered:
What is an Industrial Production Manager?

Industrial Production Managers oversee and direct the operations of manufacturing plants.

Where does an Industrial Production Manager work?

  • General manufacturing plants
  • Transportation manufacturing plants
  • Chemical manufacturing plants

How much does an Industrial Production Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Industrial Production Manager is $86,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Industrial Production Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Industrial engineering majors
  • Business administration majors
Search Industrial Production Manager jobs

Industrial Production Manager skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Industrial Production Managers succeed in their work:

  • Great communication and leadership skills
  • Great time management skills
  • Ability to think on their feet

What are some common questions about Industrial Production Managers?

Q: What degree do you need to become an Industrial Production Manager?

A: At least a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering or a related field.
